name: NewSoftwares Temporary File
summary: Learn about .### files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: Some applications use temporary files to store information they require to run. These applications create temporary files when you first launch them, and they recreate the files if they are ever moved, deleted, or missing.

### files are temporary files created by USB Block or another NewSoftwares application. These files' names begin with mbx@. Some malware detectors flag ### files as malware files. While it is unknown whether ### files actually contain malware, it is likely safest to uninstall USB Block and your other NewSoftwares applications and delete the ### files.

description: A ### file is a temporary file created by a NewSoftwares application, such as USB Block. It typically appears in the Users/​UserName/​AppData/​Roaming/​.# folder. ### files may be detected as malware. You can permanently delete ### files only after uninstalling the NewSoftwares application that is creating the files.

instructions: ### files are not meant to be opened. If you want to permanently delete the ### files a NewSoftwares application has created, you must uninstall the application and then delete the files.
